intro: Chloanthes hemigenioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming a dense rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are highly valued in horticulture for their beauty and ease of care. Chloanthes hemigenioides thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
